title: 946-B
statement: B. Weird Subtraction Processtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou have two variablesaandb. Consider the following sequence of actions performed with these variables:Ifa= 0orb= 0, end the process. Otherwise, go to step2;Ifa≥ 2·b, then set the value ofatoa- 2·b, and repeat step1. Otherwise, go to step3;Ifb≥ 2·a, then set the value ofbtob- 2·a, and repeat step1. Otherwise, end the process.Initially the values ofaandbare positive integers, and so the process will be finite.You have to determine the values ofaandbafter the process ends.InputThe only line of the input contains two integersnandm(1 ≤n,m≤ 1018).nis the initial value of variablea, andmis the initial value of variableb.OutputPrint two integers — the values ofaandbafter the end of the process.ExamplesInput12 5Output0 1Input31 12Output7 12NoteExplanations to the samples:a= 12,b= 5a= 2,b= 5a= 2,b= 1a= 0,b= 1;a= 31,b= 12a= 7,b= 12.
